name: a(n) is the smallest k such that tau(k^2 + 1) is equal to 2^n, where tau = A000005 and a(n) = -1 if no such k exists.
mathematica: a[n_]:=Module[{k=0}, While[DivisorSigma[0, k^2+1]!=2^n, k++]; k]; Array[a, 9,0] (* _Stefano Spezia_, Feb 10 2025 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(k=0); while (numdiv(k^2+1) != 2^n, k++); k; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 09 2025
author: _Juri-Stepan Gerasimov_, Feb 09 2025
